column5: There is a piranha prop demo going on tomorrow morning at a local Ottawa tackle shop and I was wondering if anyone has one and what they think of them? I need a new prop and checking out their website they sound pretty good and are fairly inexpensive. Do they break easy? Are they trouble free? Any performance issues?  Any info is greatly appreciated. thanks, brufan
are they the ones that went with a composite prop now...  I don't know if like them as the main prop, but would make a great spare..if they still make SS and aluminum..then never mind

I just quickley checked it out and my dad and I were looking at it for our boat because we hit bottom a few times and instead of replacing the whole prop we were going to buy it so we can just change one wing. Next time we hit bottom on simcoe we took of our prop and looked at it and realized when you hit the whole prop needs to be replaced if you want top performance. I don't know what the performace is but that's why we did not buy it.
Here is a short video you may find interesting:    Regards, Snowball
